title: Ezekiel Chapter 45 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ezekiel chapter 45 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ezekiel Chapter 45 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ezekiel Chapter 45.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 45:1, what is the length of the holy portion of the land?
options: Five and twenty thousand reeds
Ten thousand reeds
Five hundred cubits
Fifty cubits
questions.correctAnswer: Five and twenty thousand reeds
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:1 states the length shall be the length of five and twenty thousand reeds for the holy portion of the land.

questions.question: What are the dimensions of the sanctuary within the holy portion as described in Ezekiel 45:2?
options: Five hundred by five hundred
Ten thousand by five thousand
Twenty-five thousand by ten thousand
Fifty by fifty cubits
questions.correctAnswer: Five hundred by five hundred
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:2 describes the sanctuary as five hundred in length and five hundred in breadth, square round about.

questions.question: Who is the holy portion of the land designated for according to Ezekiel 45:4?
options: The priests, ministers of the sanctuary
The Levites
The prince
The whole house of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: The priests, ministers of the sanctuary
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:4 states the holy portion is for the priests, the ministers of the sanctuary.

questions.question: What shall the Levites have for themselves according to Ezekiel 45:5?
options: A possession for twenty chambers
A portion of the city
A pasture for their flocks
A share of the oblation
questions.correctAnswer: A possession for twenty chambers
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:5 says the Levites shall have the land for a possession for twenty chambers.

questions.question: How broad shall the possession of the city be as stated in Ezekiel 45:6?
options: Five thousand broad
Ten thousand broad
Twenty-five thousand broad
Five hundred broad
questions.correctAnswer: Five thousand broad
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:6 specifies the possession of the city shall be five thousand broad.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 45:9 commands the princes of Israel to remove violence and execute judgment and justice.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:9 instructs the princes to remove violence and spoil and to execute judgment and justice.

questions.question: What kind of measures shall be used according to Ezekiel 45:10?
options: Just balances, a just ephah, and a just bath
Imperfect measures
Ancient Egyptian measures
Measures of gold and silver
questions.correctAnswer: Just balances, a just ephah, and a just bath
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:10 states that just balances, a just ephah, and a just bath shall be used.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 45:12, how many gerahs are in a shekel?
options: Twenty gerahs
Ten gerahs
Thirty gerahs
Fifteen gerahs
questions.correctAnswer: Twenty gerahs
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:12 says the shekel shall be twenty gerahs.

questions.question: What is the oblation specified in Ezekiel 45:13?
options: The sixth part of an ephah of wheat and barley
A tenth part of a bath of oil
One lamb out of two hundred
Seven bullocks and seven rams
questions.correctAnswer: The sixth part of an ephah of wheat and barley
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:13 specifies an oblation of the sixth part of an ephah of wheat and barley.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Ezekiel 45:15: 'And one lamb out of the flock, out of ______, out of the fat pastures of Israel.'
options: two hundred
fifty
one hundred
three hundred
questions.correctAnswer: two hundred
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:15 states one lamb out of the flock, out of two hundred, from the fat pastures of Israel.

questions.question: Who shall give the oblation for the prince in Israel according to Ezekiel 45:16?
options: All the people of the land
Only the priests
Only the Levites
Only the prince
questions.correctAnswer: All the people of the land
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:16 says all the people of the land shall give this oblation for the prince.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 45:17 says the prince is responsible for preparing offerings only on the sabbaths.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:17 states the prince shall prepare offerings on feasts, new moons, sabbaths, and all solemnities, not just sabbaths.

questions.question: What animal is to be taken on the first day of the first month to cleanse the sanctuary as per Ezekiel 45:18?
options: A young bullock without blemish
A lamb without blemish
A goat
A kid of the goats
questions.correctAnswer: A young bullock without blemish
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:18 commands taking a young bullock without blemish to cleanse the sanctuary.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ezekiel 45:21, the Passover feast lasts for seven days and unleavened bread shall be eaten.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:21 states the Passover feast lasts seven days with unleavened bread eaten.

questions.question: How many bullocks and rams are to be offered daily during the seven days of the feast as described in Ezekiel 45:23?
options: Seven bullocks and seven rams
One bullock and one ram
Ten bullocks and ten rams
Five bullocks and five rams
questions.correctAnswer: Seven bullocks and seven rams
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:23 specifies seven bullocks and seven rams without blemish daily during the seven days.

medium.title: Ezekiel Chapter 45 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ezekiel Chapter 45 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 45 instruct believers to practice honesty and integrity in daily life?
options: By using just balances, ephah, and bath
By giving more than required in offerings
By forgiving all debts
By offering sacrifices daily
questions.correctAnswer: By using just balances, ephah, and bath
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:9-11 emphasizes the importance of just balances, ephah, and bath to ensure fairness and integrity in commerce and daily dealings.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with contentment and greed. Based on Ezekiel 45, what biblical principle would you share?
options: Give only your sixth part of an ephah as an offering
Practice fair measures and avoid oppression
Hold tightly to possessions for security
Seek riches through any means necessary
questions.correctAnswer: Practice fair measures and avoid oppression
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:9 commands removing violence and spoil and executing judgment and justice, teaching believers to avoid greed and practice fairness.

questions.question: What does Ezekiel 45 teach about the role of the prince in offering sacrifices?
options: The prince must prepare burnt, meat, and drink offerings during feasts and sabbaths
The prince is exempt from offerings
The prince only offers on new moons
The prince offers only peace offerings
questions.correctAnswer: The prince must prepare burnt, meat, and drink offerings during feasts and sabbaths
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:17 explains the prince's responsibility to prepare various offerings in all solemnities, underscoring faithfulness in worship leaders.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 45 encourage believers to deal with sin and reconciliation?
options: By offering sin offerings and making reconciliation regularly
By ignoring sins and focusing on works
By punishing sinners harshly
By avoiding fellowship with sinners
questions.correctAnswer: By offering sin offerings and making reconciliation regularly
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:15, 17, and 20 demonstrate that sin offerings and reconciliation are integral to maintaining holiness and relationship with God.

questions.question: A believer is struggling to forgive a neighbor. What insight from Ezekiel 45 can you offer?
options: Reconciliation is necessary, as shown by the offerings made for peace
Ignore the offense and pray silently
Seek revenge to maintain justice
Avoid the neighbor completely
questions.correctAnswer: Reconciliation is necessary, as shown by the offerings made for peace
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:15 highlights peace offerings made to reconcile, teaching believers the importance of forgiveness and restoration.

questions.question: How does this chapter show the importance of stewardship and generosity?
options: By requiring specific offerings from all people of the land
By encouraging hoarding of resources
By limiting offerings to priests only
By making offerings optional
questions.correctAnswer: By requiring specific offerings from all people of the land
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:13-16 describes the required offerings from all the people to support the sanctuary and the prince, encouraging responsible stewardship.

questions.question: What does Ezekiel 45 teach us about humility and dependence on God in worship?
options: The prince must offer sin offerings for himself and the people
The prince can worship privately without offerings
Offerings are only symbolic and optional
Worship is only for priests, not leaders
questions.correctAnswer: The prince must offer sin offerings for himself and the people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:18-22 shows the prince taking responsibility for sin offerings, teaching humility and dependence on God's grace in leadership.

questions.question: How does the detailed description of land division in Ezekiel 45 encourage believers in stewardship?
options: By showing that God has a plan for orderly and holy use of resources
By allowing unlimited land claims
By emphasizing personal gain over community needs
By ignoring the needs of priests and Levites
questions.correctAnswer: By showing that God has a plan for orderly and holy use of resources
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:1-7 describes measured divisions for holy purposes, teaching believers to steward resources responsibly and with respect to God's order.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ezekiel 45, the prince has no role in the spiritual offerings of Israel.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:17 and 45:22 clearly assign the prince responsibilities to offer sin, burnt, and meat offerings for himself and the people.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 45 teaches that just weights and measures are essential for justice and fairness among God's people.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:10-11 instructs the use of just balances, ephah, and bath to ensure honest dealings and uphold justice.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The holy portion of the land in Ezekiel 45 is given to the ______ who minister in the sanctuary.
options: priests
Levites
princes
elders
questions.correctAnswer: priests
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:4 states the holy portion is for the priests, ministers of the sanctuary, who serve the LORD.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 45 instruct believers to approach fairness in economic transactions?
options: By removing violence and spoil and using just measures
By trusting personal judgment over measures
By allowing rulers to exploit people
By neglecting weights and balances
questions.correctAnswer: By removing violence and spoil and using just measures
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:8-10 teaches that princes should no longer oppress people and that just balances and measures must be used for fairness.

questions.question: What biblical virtue is taught through the prince's responsibility to provide offerings during festivals and new moons?
options: Faithfulness in leadership
Personal wealth accumulation
Avoidance of public worship
Selfishness
questions.correctAnswer: Faithfulness in leadership
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:17 highlights the prince's duty to lead worship faithfully, modeling obedience and devotion to God for the people.

questions.question: A believer feels burdened by the need for regular spiritual discipline. How does Ezekiel 45 encourage perseverance in worship practices?
options: By prescribing daily and seasonal offerings for continual reconciliation
By allowing worship only on major holidays
By discouraging repetitive rituals
By focusing only on personal prayer
questions.correctAnswer: By prescribing daily and seasonal offerings for continual reconciliation
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:20, 23, and 25 describe ongoing offerings during feasts and for those who err, encouraging persistent spiritual discipline.

questions.question: What lesson about humility and confession can be drawn from the cleansing of the sanctuary described in Ezekiel 45?
options: Confession and cleansing are necessary for holiness
Clearing the sanctuary is optional
Only the priests cleanse the sanctuary
Cleansing is symbolic and not required
questions.correctAnswer: Confession and cleansing are necessary for holiness
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:18-19 describes the priest using the blood of a sin offering to cleanse the sanctuary, teaching the need for confession and purification.

hard.title: Ezekiel Chapter 45 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ezekiel Chapter 45.

questions.question: What are the exact dimensions of the holy portion of the land to be offered as an oblation unto the LORD?
options: Length twenty-five thousand reeds, breadth ten thousand reeds
Length ten thousand reeds, breadth five thousand reeds
Length fifty thousand reeds, breadth twenty thousand reeds
Length five thousand reeds, breadth two thousand reeds
questions.correctAnswer: Length twenty-five thousand reeds, breadth ten thousand reeds
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:1 specifies that the holy portion of the land shall have a length of twenty-five thousand reeds and a breadth of ten thousand reeds.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 45, who is assigned the holy portion of the land for their houses and to minister unto the LORD?
options: The priests
The Levites
The princes
The elders of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: The priests
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:4 clearly states that the holy portion of the land is for the priests, the ministers of the sanctuary, who come near to minister unto the LORD.

questions.question: How is the possession of the city described in terms of its dimensions and its relation to the holy portion?
options: Five thousand broad and twenty-five thousand long, over against the oblation of the holy portion
Ten thousand broad and ten thousand long, adjacent to the priests’ land
Twenty-five thousand broad and five thousand long, surrounding the sanctuary
Five thousand broad and five thousand long, within the holy portion
questions.correctAnswer: Five thousand broad and twenty-five thousand long, over against the oblation of the holy portion
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:6 describes the possession of the city as five thousand broad and twenty-five thousand long, positioned over against the oblation of the holy portion.

questions.question: True or False: The prince’s land possession is described as being located both to the west and east of the holy portion and the city possession.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:7 states that a portion shall be for the prince on the one side and the other side of the oblation of the holy portion and of the possession of the city, from the west side westward and from the east side eastward.

questions.question: What instruction does the Lord give to the princes of Israel regarding their conduct towards the people?
options: Remove violence and spoil, execute judgment and justice, and take away exactions
Increase their wealth by collecting more exactions
Build fortifications to protect the city
Neglect the poor and focus only on the temple duties
questions.correctAnswer: Remove violence and spoil, execute judgment and justice, and take away exactions
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:9 commands the princes to remove violence and spoil, execute judgment and justice, and take away their exactions from the people of Israel.

questions.question: Which of the following measures is defined as containing the tenth part of a homer according to Ezekiel 45?
options: The ephah and the bath
The maneh and the shekel
The cubit and the reed
The homer and the hin
questions.correctAnswer: The ephah and the bath
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:11 clarifies that the ephah and the bath shall be of one measure, each containing the tenth part of an homer.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Ezekiel 45:12, the shekel shall be twenty ______.
options: gerahs
cubits
reeds
manes
questions.correctAnswer: gerahs
questions.explanation: The verse Ezekiel 45:12 clearly states that the shekel shall be twenty gerahs.

questions.question: What is the specified oblation of wheat and barley offered as described in Ezekiel 45?
options: The sixth part of an ephah of an homer of wheat and barley
A whole homer of wheat and half a homer of barley
One ephah of barley and one bath of wheat
Five ephahs of wheat and two ephahs of barley
questions.correctAnswer: The sixth part of an ephah of an homer of wheat and barley
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:13 instructs to offer the sixth part of an ephah of an homer of wheat and the sixth part of an ephah of an homer of barley as the oblation.

questions.question: What type of offering is prepared by the prince for himself and all the people during the feasts, new moons, and sabbaths?
options: Burnt offerings, meat offerings, drink offerings, and sin offerings
Only peace offerings
Only grain offerings
Only sin offerings
questions.correctAnswer: Burnt offerings, meat offerings, drink offerings, and sin offerings
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:17 states the prince's responsibility includes preparing burnt offerings, meat offerings, drink offerings, and sin offerings during all solemnities.

questions.question: In Ezekiel 45, what is the purpose of the young bullock offered on the first day of the first month?
options: To cleanse the sanctuary
To serve as a peace offering
To be sold for temple maintenance
To be given as a gift to the priests
questions.correctAnswer: To cleanse the sanctuary
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:18 specifies that on the first day of the first month a young bullock without blemish shall be taken to cleanse the sanctuary.

questions.question: How is the blood of the sin offering used in the cleansing ritual described in Ezekiel 45?
options: It is put upon the posts of the house, the four corners of the altar settle, and the posts of the gate of the inner court
It is sprinkled on the people gathered outside the temple
It is mixed with oil and anointed the priests
It is poured into the foundation trenches of the temple
questions.correctAnswer: It is put upon the posts of the house, the four corners of the altar settle, and the posts of the gate of the inner court
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:19 explains the priest shall take the blood from the sin offering and put it upon the posts of the house, the four corners of the settle of the altar, and the posts of the gate of the inner court.

questions.question: True or False: The prince is responsible for preparing daily burnt offerings and sin offerings for seven days during the feast in the first month.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:23 states that for seven days of the feast in the first month, the prince shall prepare daily burnt offerings and sin offerings.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the measure of oil offered as an ordinance in Ezekiel 45?
options: The tenth part of a bath out of the cor, an homer of ten baths
One full bath for every ephah of grain
Half a bath per offering
Two baths per homer
questions.correctAnswer: The tenth part of a bath out of the cor, an homer of ten baths
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:14 explains that concerning the ordinance of oil, a tenth part of a bath shall be offered out of the cor, which is an homer of ten baths.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 45 emphasize justice and fairness in economic transactions among the people?
options: By commanding the use of just balances, a just ephah, and a just bath
By encouraging free market trade without regulation
By allowing the princes to collect extra taxes
By specifying no standard measures to be used
questions.correctAnswer: By commanding the use of just balances, a just ephah, and a just bath
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:10 commands the use of just balances, a just ephah, and a just bath to ensure fairness in transactions.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'one lamb out of the flock, out of two hundred' mentioned in Ezekiel 45:15?
options: It represents a specific ratio for peace offerings and reconciliation
It is a mandatory tithe for the priests
It symbolizes the firstborn of the flock
It is a punishment for the people’s sins
questions.correctAnswer: It represents a specific ratio for peace offerings and reconciliation
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:15 prescribes one lamb out of two hundred for meat offerings, burnt offerings, and peace offerings to make reconciliation for the people.

theological.title: Ezekiel Chapter 45 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ezekiel Chapter 45 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 45, what is the specific measurement of the holy portion of the land set aside for the sanctuary?
options: Five hundred by five hundred cubits with fifty cubits for suburbs
Ten thousand by ten thousand reeds with one hundred reeds for suburbs
Twenty-five thousand by ten thousand reeds with fifty cubits for suburbs
Twenty-five thousand by five thousand cubits with twenty cubits for suburbs
questions.correctAnswer: Five hundred by five hundred cubits with fifty cubits for suburbs
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:2 states the sanctuary's dimensions as five hundred by five hundred cubits, square round about, with fifty cubits for the suburbs. This precise measurement emphasizes the sanctity and set-apart nature of the place for God's presence, reflecting God's holiness as also seen in Exodus 26:1-2 and Hebrews 9:1-5.

questions.question: Who is designated to receive the holy portion of the land according to Ezekiel 45?
options: The Levites, ministers of the house
The priests, ministers of the sanctuary
The prince of Israel
The entire house of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: The priests, ministers of the sanctuary
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:4 clarifies that the holy portion of the land is for the priests who minister in the sanctuary. This highlights the priestly role in mediation and worship, paralleling the Old Testament priesthood (Leviticus 21:1-6) and the New Testament's fulfillment in Christ as the great High Priest (Hebrews 7:23-28).

questions.question: What instruction does the Lord give to the princes of Israel regarding their conduct toward the people?
options: Remove violence and spoil, execute justice and judgment
Increase taxes to support the temple
Build fortifications for the city
Gather armies to protect the land
questions.correctAnswer: Remove violence and spoil, execute justice and judgment
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:9 commands the princes to cease violence and oppression and to practice justice and fairness. This reflects God's attribute of justice (Psalm 89:14) and the biblical mandate for righteous leadership (Proverbs 29:2; Isaiah 1:17).

questions.question: What measures are prescribed for balances, ephahs, and baths in Ezekiel 45?
options: Just balances, a just ephah, and a just bath
Arbitrary measures based on local customs
Double weights and measures
No specific measures are prescribed
questions.correctAnswer: Just balances, a just ephah, and a just bath
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:10 instructs the use of just balances and measures, showing God's demand for honesty and integrity in commerce (Leviticus 19:35-36; Proverbs 11:1; Deuteronomy 25:13-16). This reflects God's holiness and righteousness extending to social ethics.

questions.question: How many gerahs make up one shekel according to Ezekiel 45?
options: Ten gerahs
Twenty gerahs
Thirty gerahs
Forty gerahs
questions.correctAnswer: Twenty gerahs
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:12 states that one shekel equals twenty gerahs. This precise monetary measure underlines God's orderliness and justice, consistent with other biblical laws regulating weights and money (Genesis 23:16; Leviticus 27:25).

questions.question: What is the nature of the oblation to be offered by the people of the land for the prince, according to Ezekiel 45?
options: A tenth of the harvest and one lamb out of two hundred
Half of the produce and two lambs per family
Only oil and wine offerings
No oblation is required for the prince
questions.correctAnswer: A tenth of the harvest and one lamb out of two hundred
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:13-15 prescribes the offering of a sixth part of an ephah of wheat and barley, a tenth of a bath of oil, and one lamb out of every two hundred. This reveals the principle of sacrificial giving as an act of reconciliation and worship, foreshadowing Christ's atoning work (Romans 12:1; Hebrews 10:1-18).

questions.question: What responsibility does the prince have concerning offerings and feasts in Ezekiel 45?
options: He shall give burnt offerings, meat offerings, and drink offerings during all solemnities
He is exempt from any offerings
He only gives offerings during the Passover
He provides offerings only when the people request
questions.correctAnswer: He shall give burnt offerings, meat offerings, and drink offerings during all solemnities
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:17 assigns to the prince the responsibility to prepare all offerings during feasts, new moons, sabbaths, and solemnities, highlighting his role as mediator and intercessor, prefiguring the Messianic King who intercedes for the people (Psalm 110:4; Hebrews 7:22-28).

questions.question: On the first day of the first month, what specific act is commanded for cleansing the sanctuary?
options: Take a young bullock without blemish for a sin offering
Sprinkle water from the river Jordan
Offer a grain offering of fine flour
Light lamps in the sanctuary
questions.correctAnswer: Take a young bullock without blemish for a sin offering
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:18 commands taking a young bullock without blemish for cleansing the sanctuary, symbolizing purification and holiness, which is consistent with the Day of Atonement rituals (Leviticus 16:3-34) and the ultimate cleansing by Christ's sacrifice (Hebrews 9:11-14).

questions.question: What is done with the blood of the sin offering in the sanctuary cleansing ritual?
options: It is put upon the posts of the house, the altar, and the gate of the inner court
It is poured at the base of the altar only
It is sprinkled on the people
It is not used in the ritual
questions.correctAnswer: It is put upon the posts of the house, the altar, and the gate of the inner court
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:19 details that the priest places the blood on the posts of the house, the altar corners, and the gate posts, symbolizing cleansing and protection, paralleling the blood of the Passover lamb on doorposts (Exodus 12:7) and Christ's blood marking believers (Revelation 7:3).

questions.question: How often is the sanctuary cleansing repeated for those who err or are simple?
options: Every day
Every seventh day
Once a year
Only as needed
questions.correctAnswer: Every seventh day
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:20 instructs that the cleansing is done on the seventh day of the month for every sinner and simple person, indicating God's continual provision for repentance and sanctification, consistent with the Sabbath as a time for restoration (Leviticus 23:3; Hebrews 4:9-11).

questions.question: What feast is to be observed on the fourteenth day of the first month according to Ezekiel 45?
options: The Feast of Tabernacles
The Passover feast of seven days with unleavened bread
The Feast of Weeks
The Day of Atonement
questions.correctAnswer: The Passover feast of seven days with unleavened bread
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:21 directs the celebration of Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month, lasting seven days with unleavened bread, emphasizing redemption and God's deliverance, which is foundational to biblical salvation history (Exodus 12:1-28; 1 Corinthians 5:7-8).

questions.question: During the Passover feast, what offerings shall the prince prepare for the people?
options: A bullock for a sin offering and daily burnt offerings of bullocks, rams, and kids
Only grain offerings
No offerings are prepared by the prince
Offerings only on the first day
questions.correctAnswer: A bullock for a sin offering and daily burnt offerings of bullocks, rams, and kids
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:22-23 commands the prince to prepare a sin offering bullock on the first day and seven days of burnt offerings including bullocks, rams, and kids, highlighting the comprehensive atonement and worship required, foreshadowing Christ’s perfect sacrifice (Hebrews 10:11-14).

questions.question: What is the prescribed quantity of meat offering and oil for each bullock and ram during the feast?
options: An ephah of meat offering and a hin of oil for an ephah
Two ephahs of meat offering and no oil
A half ephah of meat offering and a quarter hin of oil
No meat offering or oil is prescribed
questions.correctAnswer: An ephah of meat offering and a hin of oil for an ephah
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:24 states the meat offering is an ephah per bullock or ram, with a hin of oil per ephah, symbolizing dedication and consecration to God, consistent with Levitical offerings (Leviticus 2:1-16) and typifying Christ’s anointing by the Spirit (Luke 4:18).

questions.question: In the seventh month on the fifteenth day, what feast and offerings are to be observed according to Ezekiel 45?
options: The Feast of Tabernacles with sin, burnt, meat offerings, and oil as in the first month feast
The Feast of Weeks with grain offerings only
The Day of Atonement with only sin offerings
No feast is prescribed for this day
questions.correctAnswer: The Feast of Tabernacles with sin, burnt, meat offerings, and oil as in the first month feast
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:25 mandates a similar observance in the seventh month as in the first month feast, including sin, burnt, meat offerings, and oil, highlighting God's provision for continual fellowship and atonement, aligning with Leviticus 23:33-44 and emphasizing eschatological hope (Zechariah 14:16-19).

questions.question: What is the significance of the prince's possession in the land according to Ezekiel 45?
options: It signifies the end of oppression by princes over God's people
It is for his personal wealth accumulation
It is to be shared with foreign nations
It is temporary and to be given away yearly
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies the end of oppression by princes over God's people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 45:8 declares that the prince's possession in the land will mark an end to oppression by princes, emphasizing God's justice and covenantal faithfulness to protect His people, consistent with prophetic calls for just rulers (Isaiah 32:1-4; Micah 6:8).
